author: ralexstokes
content:
Here's a proposal to uncouple the blob count b/t CL and EL: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3800

there's some subtlety around optimistic syncing, so it would be great if you could take a look before ACDC tomorrow where we can discuss further

author: terence0083
content: I am confused, and it's probably just my misunderstanding. Isn't the plan to send the maximum blob count for every new payload? If so, shouldn't it be under `NewPayloadRequest` instead of `PayloadAttribute`? We only send `PayloadAttribute` if we are the proposer for the subsequent block and want to build a block.

author: g11tech
content: I think EL should just validate the real max=4096, apart from that CL just tells EL what it should produce (and its job of CL to consensus enforce on what the current max is)

author: g11tech
content:
regarding optimistic sync as I also mentioned in peerDAS breakout call, the entire parent chain is sort of "validated" because of the head fcU and blocks have blobGasUsed header param (as well as versioned hashes in transactions) to verify against blob count

Also ELs don't really sync blobs in optimistic sync (unless they want to for some reason)

author: terence0083
content: Other than max=4096, what about blob transaction mempool rules? Do they want to accurately know how many blobs can be in a block on a slot-by-slot basis?

author: g11tech
content: i don't think so from my ethereumjs insight, but may be other clients would wanna pitch in

author: g11tech
content: i think the blob pricing might be an issue if target is to be kept low/dynamic (other than 2048)

author: g11tech
content: Or we can have it other way around: ELs can dynamically increase target (by some percentage bump till 2048) if if excess gas > some threshold (so price proportional) or just if gas used > some threshold above target

author: g11tech
content: this way ELs will be able to auto determine what the max blob count should be (so something like gas limit bump ceiling  rule)

author: g11tech
content: or they can just incorporate this new input from CL in their block header (like blobGasLimit)

author: g11tech
content: I like this from any of the above options as it seems more straightforward
